website_summaries.verdict: User-friendly design for long-distance runners who like to switch music often.
pros: Rotates 180°, so you can adjust viewing angle without taking off armband
Fits phones up to 5.5 inches, including iPhone 8
cons: A few reports that design makes phone jiggle when running

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Had this item for 6 months now the velcro still straps like it's brand new and never have a problem with the spinning my phone to read text or E-mails and to pick a song from my play list
customer_reviews.author: Hector Troche

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just received it in the mail and tried it on my phone it looks really nice and feels comfortable on my arm. It secures my phone nice and tight. I will be testing it out tomorrow at the gym. Update #2 I've used it several times at the gym for many different excercies and it works great. Fits my iPhone 6 with lifeproof case on perfectly. I would recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I really like the product. It perfectly fits my iPhone 8Plus. I went jogging and I’ve worked out with it without drama. It feels comfortable on my arm.
customer_reviews.author: Cedrick Ntambwe

customer_reviews.title: It's better than carrying it in my cleavage
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it's a bit bulky for a woman. Now mind you, my Samsung 8+ is awfully large, which is most of the problem. It's better than carrying it in my cleavage!!! hah!
customer_reviews.author: Queen of Bling

customer_reviews.title: I combed through reviews looking for the best option for an iPhone 8 plus
customer_reviews.text: A well made product... I combed through reviews looking for the best option for an iPhone 8 plus, and everyone seemed to rave about this one. Ultimately the phone was still jiggling on my arm and obnoxious to use. Definitely not good for running, maybe some other kind of workout. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: stephsam

customer_reviews.title: Band is not suitable for woman
customer_reviews.text: I can not get the band tight enough. It's like it is for a large man. Would be a nice product if the band was adjustable and would fit a woman.
customer_reviews.author: Karen J Woodall

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: One of the rubber holders broke after second use on an iPhone 7 Plus.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Marginally functional
customer_reviews.text: This armband keeps triggering apps on the phone so my exercise app is not readily visible as I workout. It also was raising a blister on the inside of my arm by the end of a one hour workout. Fit my Pixel 3 XL without a case. Will fit with a case, but that much harder to get the phone installed. Makes accessing the touch sensor almost impossible if the screen locks. Update.... I discovered the next day in the shower that it had actually rubbed me raw. Downgraded stars.
customer_reviews.author: Beth C

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't (really) work with the new iPhone XR
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a decent, well-constructed product and I was looking forward to using it -- but unfortunately the design of it covers up the most important parts of the iPhone XR. It's difficult to swipe up to get to the home screen; it covers the front camera for Face ID; you can't swipe down from the upper-right corner to access the Control Center. If you have an older model where the screen doesn't take up the entire face the of the phone you probably won't have any problems with this, but otherwise I would look for something different.
customer_reviews.author: Moneypenny

customer_reviews.title: Its alright
customer_reviews.text: First off its kinda of large and bulky. I thought it would tighten enough to put on my wrist and arm and it so large I have to tighten it all the way just to get it to stay on my bicep and I am fairly large person over all. With it being on your arm the fact that it rotates does not really add much functionality since its at a awkward angle on your arm. And if you did need to remove your phone to use it, you can not get the rubber bands over the corners of your phone with out both hands with is incredibly inconvient.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan harris

customer_reviews.title: Not what it seems!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this thinking this would be great for my phone for when I workout... NOPE. One of the rubber band-like parts snapped the second I tried putting my phone into it... It repeatedly fell off of my arm and kept coming unvelcroed. Also, if you have an iPhone X, you can't swipe up with how this is made. The description on this product should NOT include that it is compatible with the iPhone X.
customer_reviews.author: Allison C.

customer_reviews.title: ... falling out and fits on my arm without being annoying hardly notice its
customer_reviews.text: This fit my note 8 snugly without worry of it falling out and fits on my arm without being annoying hardly notice its there
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Almost there a few changes needed
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of being able to twist the phone to look at it while running when I want to check distance, speed, or change a song. Problem is the arm band only rotates 180 deg. When it is on your bicep it is still not quite enough of a rotation to look at the phone the way I want too unless I put my phone in upside down. I also wish there was a way to quickly disconnect the phone from the arm band without removing the phone from the band or taking it out of the rubber straps that hold the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Shanesucre

customer_reviews.title: I have only used it once so far. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once so far. I have a Samsung Galaxy 7 with an otter box cover and you really need to stretch the bands to get the phone to fit. As to the fit on the arm, if you have small arms,you really have to maneuver it around to make it work. The band comes with 2 slots for the strap, but sometimes it is so tight it is uncomfortable and if you loosen it, then it falls off.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 17 months, 2x week usage
customer_reviews.text: I think all of the bands like this are probably similarly made. Mine lasted for seventeen months of being used for running at most 2 times per week. In the summer months when I am wearing a tank top, it will sometimes rub abrasions on my side where the skin is exposed. Because of the angle of the phone on my upper arm (has to be angled to bend your elbow and still see the screen if necessary), the phone will also rub a sore just inside my forearm. Additionally, mine is super stinky from sweating directly onto the band in the summer months. I am not seeing many better options available though. I am an average sized 5'6" female.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Feels durable and secure
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed and happy with this buy!! The band seems durable, the rotating attachment appears to be very secure and the bands that hold the phone in place are very secure. The bands that hold the phone In place fit securely around my phone without the case and with the case. Being able to rotate the phone is a plus, I would always have to take my band off with my previous case and often take my phone out because the touch screen and home button wouldn’t work if I didn’t. There are two slots on the band to change the sizing so this fits arms of various sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Cuocco

customer_reviews.title: When i first opened this product it looked super small. It does stretch and fits an iphone ...
customer_reviews.text: When i first opened this product it looked super small. It does stretch and fits an iphone 7, with a case! and pop out socket. The rotation aspect of it is not as sleek as i expected, It's a bit stiff making it difficult to twist while doing any exercise, but it does twist. the makers of this product where pretty cool, reaching out to me often to ask questions about how i'm enjoying the product. i think this product is reliable, if you have a big phone, like the iphone + phones or just big screen phone in general it may be a pain to put on. but otherwise it is good
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Not washable and that's a problem
customer_reviews.text: This keeps my cellphone secured to my arm while running. It's also comfortable and doesn't get in the way. But there is no way to thoroughly was it. I even tried the washing machine (not the dryer) and while it was undamaged and air-dried just fine, it still did not get clean from odors resulting from sweating. This would be good for minor workouts where you don't sweat much. But if you are doing heavy workouts where you will be sweating a lot, keep in mind you will not be able to wash it and it may get an odor.
customer_reviews.author: drewnten

customer_reviews.title: Solid Quality - Recommended - Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good quality armband. Quick important points. 1. Works perfectly for my iphones - Multiple IPhones work fine. 2. Has velcro that extends the entire legnth of the bank, which offers greater flexibility 3. It doesn't have a plastic screen so touch for iPhone works perfect. 4. The pivot for the phone is an awesome touch, certainly helps in changing the song etc as I am running. 5. The armband seems pretty sturdy, I have used flimsy armbands before that have torn due to the fact that it gets tugged and pulled on and is usually wet from seat.
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $$, I returned.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was completely useless for me.. it slid down before I even got to working out, and bending my arms was not only uncomfortable, but borderline painful. I had to remove it before I event started. Just walking around, I knew it wouldn’t be a good match. I think a handheld one would suit my needs better.
customer_reviews.author: Dressed for Time

customer_reviews.title: Love the accessibility
customer_reviews.text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS ARMBAND!!! The accessibility of this armband. I am former Marine that went through multiple armbands during training and the accessibility of this band is much better than any other band. The only flaw that I can point out with this band is that the face of phone is exposed. So I would definitely recommend the use of screen shield. But to have the ability to rotate the phone without removing the phone from the band is a huge plus for me. I recommend a buy for this product for the purposes of exercising.
customer_reviews.author: clifton2000

customer_reviews.title: Running armband little anxiety- but great!
customer_reviews.text: This took some getting used to. After a month, I still have some anxiety about the bands ripping and my phone falling. I have the iPhone 6s Plus, but have an otter box on it. Without the box it would fit perfectly fine. But if you have a box you know it’s a pain to take off and on especially if you have to do it daily. I will say that it fits with my box, I just feel the bands have to stretch and I worry they will snap. I waited a month, with daily use to write the review and so far so good. If they do end up breaking I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE - Strong armband
customer_reviews.text: *** UPDATE: The company reached out to offer a replacement or refund for this armband due to this review. Very happy with the professionalism of the company and their ongoing efforts to leave the customer with a good customer service experience.***** Adjustable bands to hold phone. Swivels 90° both directions. Strong velcro straps. The couple of cons, personally, if you've got small or very thin biceps or arms , it feels it's going to fall off (it has not as I can adjust it) and it doesn't have place to hold key, only wired headphones which I don't have, so that compartment is useless. Overall a good product
customer_reviews.author: Ana B in SJCV

customer_reviews.title: Phone feels like it's going to fall out! NOT SECURE!
customer_reviews.text: Much better products out there. The phone feels like it's about to fall out, not secure at all! I was out of town and didn't have the chance to return the item, now I'm stuck with this junk!
customer_reviews.author: edna Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Velcro is uncomfortable and hard to put phone in with it on your arm
customer_reviews.text: I wore it for winter, it was comfortable enough with my long sleeves. Then recently I've jogged with T-Shirt, and the velcro was rubbing against my skin. Very uncomfortable. It holds the phone perfectly, I don't have to worry about it going anywhere. However, you can't have the arm band on your arm and THEN put the phone in place. It's a two hand process. It's a bother if I need to pull my phone out (which is okay enough with one hand) and then I need to put it back, I have to remove the whole band. It's nearly impossible to put your phone in with one hand, let alone the arm band on your arm.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great arm band, love the 360, slightly uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept of the 360 swivel and the design overall is top notch. The only downside is the hook and loop (velcro) system can be uncomfortable at times. Since it is an armband, it has to be tight on your arm. Sometimes the hook aspect of the velcro scratches my arm because it is just as wide as the loop side of the arm band. If it were a little more narrow, it wouldn't scratch my arm as much. Overall, I would buy again though. Super durable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Cortney Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Bounces a little too much
customer_reviews.text: Because phones are a bit bigger these days, for the most part, you have to really tighten down around your arm being that the mount is raised a little off the arm. Although the rotation feature is kind of cool, it caused the phone to rest off of the arm and allows it to bounce, which I personally find annoying while running. I may be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Cercone

customer_reviews.title: Sort of, but not totally
customer_reviews.text: This pretty much serves it's purpose. It will hold my phone while I am running, doing chores, etc. It is a bit of a struggle to get my phone in, which is annoying, but then the phone is very secure when it get's settled into the holder. Also, it's rather inconvenient using the phone (even changing songs) while it's on my arm. I have a small arm, and I can barely tighten it enough to stay on my arm, and I often have to tighten/rearrange it. I would never buy another of these. When I upgrade my phone, I will not get another for a new phone model. NEVER AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great for a run!
customer_reviews.text: I wear this while I run outdoors. I was a little hesitant about it because of the way your phone is secured with those rubber bands, but it keeps it in there so snug! For reference, I have a Google Pixel 2XL and I have a slim case on it with pop socket, I don't have to take the phone out of that in order to put in the arm band. It's super easy. Stays snug on my arm during my high impact runs. After a long run 1 Hr + I would say it might start to get a little irritating. Overall, I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: EEK

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Sticks out way to much to be practical for running or any other athletic activity.
customer_reviews.author: Sean and Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Best one i've had thus far!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of it because of the make of it, didn't look secure or sturdy. I tried it on and it felt great as if nothing was on my arm. Fit my S9 + with a case fine and felt secure. Does not feel bulky at all and fit my forearm as well as my bicep. I used the second hole, I don't think I hav e big arms; looping it through both holes felt a lil tight and I didn't want to restrict blood flow while working out. Used it while lifting and it was secure, made my phone accessible to look at for my next work out and out of the way! Getting one for my wife!
customer_reviews.author: FreeWay

customer_reviews.title: Too BULKY
customer_reviews.text: I have a case on my phone which isn't the easiest to remove. In order to fit into the mechanism, I had to remove the case and it barely even fit after that. SUPER tight squeeze, and a pain to get in. Once I managed to get it in, It was so heavy on my arm and really hindered my movement. Not ideal for a broad range of arm movement, especially in headphones. Needs wireless headphones. But still the whole contraption made me feel weighed down and hindered. SKIP THIS PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy little device, perfect for jogging
customer_reviews.text: This little device is perfect for my jogging routine. I don’t have to worry about my phone falling out. It fits super snug. It is easy to access because it doesn’t go inside of some crummy case. The rotating feature is also great for checking incoming messages or calls. The only thing I’ve had issues with is making sure the Velcro is in just the right spot when I put it on, otherwise it digs into my arm and can be quite painful during a run.
customer_reviews.author: K Jinks

customer_reviews.title: Good so far!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, for now. My past experience with armbands is that the Velcro wears out in less than 6 months. The Velcro on this band looks built to last. I do really like the 180 rotation for changing music while running. Again we'll see how long that piece holds up. But with a 36 month warranty, I shouldn't have anything to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: J&E Begonia

customer_reviews.title: NOT for women... or non bodybuilders
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'8, 145 lbs with extremely muscular arms, and my arm would have needed to be 3x larger for this band to fit. The design is absolutely amazing otherwise, but why they would use a tiny strip of velcrow at the end of the gigantic band is completely beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: BBW

customer_reviews.title: keeping my phone secure
customer_reviews.text: This device is good in use for maybe until you can't send it back, lol. The rubber that holds your phone secure quickly stretches, only way to place phone in holder, thus your phone quickly starts falling out as you work out. The rotation of base good idea for viewing while in use, but if phone keep falling out what good is it?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only acceptable a band for working out.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I found this. It is cheaper than many other bands I have bought that have broke within a year and barely fit my phone. The elastic band is incredibly durable and doesn’t cutoff circulation when you make it tight enough to not slide during a run (and also fits around my bicep without stressing or ripping the seam). It fit my iPhone 8 Plus wonderfully, the rotation device is solid and easy to use mid-run if needed, and the best feature of all is no plastic pocket that goes around your phone. No more unusable touch screen and screens going dark due to the pocket covering the light sensor on to phone.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: One Year Later
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one year ago (actually on my birthday). For the most part, I really like this arm band. However, a year later I am buying it again. The velcro on the arm band is not sticking anymore and comes apart easily. But, I do like it enough, obviously to purchase again one year later. The only other thing I do not like is the bottom where you plug in your headphones or charger (iPhone 8+). It is hard to get the cord into the phone of how they have the rubber that covers that area. They might want to think about redesigning that part.
customer_reviews.author: ahotdj

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Arm band is a little uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second phone armband. As phones have gotten bigger, they have outgrown my previous armband. The VUP armband does the job. I've jogged with it for about two weeks. My only real complaint is that the armband itself is a touch uncomfortable. The edges sort of dig into my skin, so I'll readjust it once awhile. I don't really trust the elastic bands that secure the phone either. They haven't torn or anything yet, but I just can't see them lasting longer than a few months. Of course, this is pure speculation. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: J. McAllister

customer_reviews.title: VUP Running Armband is the Real Deal!
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of choices on Amazon when it comes to smartphone armbands. I think I selected and purchased the best of them all, the VUP Running Armband for my Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge. It's smart looking, constructed of durable material, and the fit on my arm is perfect. Best of all my smartphone fits snugly on the swivel arm piece. I am very pleased with this purchase and encourage others who are looking for a similar armband to consider the VUP Armband!
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: iPhone X fits
customer_reviews.text: I use this arm band with my iPhone X when I run at first I was worried that it wasn’t going to hold the phone but after the straps go over the corner it’s snug just fine. Facial recognition still works good and it also has a little pocket for a house key which is a nice touch. The phone cradle also spins so you can adjust the phone on your arm
customer_reviews.author: Brannon

customer_reviews.title: will not separate from arm band
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 2 of them and after only a couple months the rubber bands that hold the phone to the device broke. We sent it back to Amazon for replacement and got one that you can NOT get to release from the arm band. We sent it back and received a second one and when we received it, it had the same problem. Neither came with any instructions. However since mine worked ok, we tried to use the 2 replacements, but they will NOT release no matter how you try. We would appreciate a couple replacements that function properly because we like the concept. Harold cell # 775-790-1155.
customer_reviews.author: Harold W

customer_reviews.title: A must buy for runners!!
customer_reviews.text: I run 5 miles average and it stays in place I don’t have to fuzz with it, definitely have to wear it with a shirt with sleeves because on bare skin it’s irritating other than that an amazing product. Price it’s amazing considering how well made.
customer_reviews.author: Keyla

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough for a good workout.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to have my iPhone hands free when working out. A lot of the arm bands slide the iPhone into a pocket but then the phone doesn’t always fit if it has a case. I thought this would do the job since the silicone brackets go around the phone edges. Unfortunately, it just doesn’t feel that sturdy and I feel like my phone will pop out. It’s also hard to stay up on your bicep. I would avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: The armband is working well for both my wife and me. It remains in place no matter what exercise we are doing. Because it pivots, to allows us to be able to me more easily view the screen. The only issue is that one of the rubber holders does overlap the thumb/finger access button the smart phone, but it is easy to adapt. I love the fact that there is a place for the earbud cords to be stored or minimized. One small suggestion would be for the manufacturer to change the color of the directions on the box. Tiny off-white print on a chartreuse background makes a challenge for anyone's eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Works for the price but dont expect it to last long
customer_reviews.text: The product does exactly as it states, but it is made very cheaply and you can tell right away. Unless you have thick forearms the only place this will stay is your bicep. It will also slid down after you start to sweat. I am an average build guy, but i have had other products work just fine but then again i have also had worse products. Take it as you will.
customer_reviews.author: steven Anderson

customer_reviews.title: You should probably keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: I am just barely ok with this. The Velcro band is uncomfortable and interferes with my arm swing while walking. Not sure how long the rubber bands that hold the phone in place will last. The turning mechanism is cool and I use it. Overall not anywhere near as happy as the one I used in the past. Also, the website has glitches and I cannot register the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Witte

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the gym
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Most sizes of phones fit. The phone is held in place by strong rubber bands which stretch over pretty much any size phone and the phone is still completely useable. None of the buttons or swipe points are covered. The phone easily rotates on the band so you can have the phone vertical or horizontal on your arm and you can rotate while it's on your arm. That's super handy at the gym if you're counting reps and need to enter them into your phone. It fits snug with a wide and strong velcro strap. Sweat doesn't affect it and it stays on your arm through even vigorous exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Holman

customer_reviews.title: The elastics are strong and durable on the armband.
customer_reviews.text: This armband was what I needed for my daily run. I was hesitant to run after putting the elastic over my iPhone 11 Pro max. I kept thinking that my phone would fly off. I must say, the elastics are strong and durable. It kept my phone snuggled in the case. The rotating device was a bonus. It’s was easy to twist and stayed in place when I needed to answer my phone or text.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Grace

customer_reviews.title: Solid and comfortable to wear with my Moto G4 Plus
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great with my "Moto G4 Plus" phone. Holders like this in the past, always feel like it's going to slip off of my arm, but this stays put. Being able to adjust how tight it is helps. I have a case on my phone and when I was taking this off, I just pulled it over the corners instead of pulling the corners out and over the edges of my phone/case and ended up breaking the ends of my phone case. Totally my bad. This holder condenses down pretty easily to fit into my purse. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amber G

customer_reviews.title: Great for running
customer_reviews.text: I ran with it and it was great. It stayed on and I like the fact that I can touch the screen without having to touch harder through plastic. However, I couldn't swipe from the top since the elastic holding it in place was in the way. Also the elastic also hid the camera for the retinal scan for the phone to recognize my face. Another issue I found it that there isn't enough hook part of the hook and loop to hook onto the rest of the strap for smaller arm. My arm is at the limit and I'm afraid with constant use the elastic of the strap would stretch and I wouldn't be able to fasten it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed!
customer_reviews.text: This armband delivers as promised. I totally recommend this for anyone looking for a comfortable and easy to handle armband for their iPhone 8. I like the rubber band holder style. Yes, it jiggles a slight bit when you are moving your arm/running but it fits so snugly in the bands that I don't worry about if falling out. The bands seem durable and the phone fits perfectly so no need to stretch out bands. I purchased it a few months ago so I can't attest to long-term wear and tear. Bottom line- it's a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SeeShell

customer_reviews.title: Good value, well made. Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I use this during weightlifting and cardio training. I have fairly big arms, so this fits snug on the last adjustment. It doesn’t seem to slip during sets. The rubber has held up well. I pre stretched it before putting my I phone 11 in it. No problems, it holds it great. My only negative is that if you don’t attach the Velcro exactly, it can catch on your clothing. I wear sleeveless T work out shirts.
customer_reviews.author: turbo

customer_reviews.title: Great for running!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this armband! Fits my note 8 without any trouble, has a small slot to slide a key and hold it and fits very comfortably on my arm with plenty of adjustability. I have been running with this for about a year now between 3-6 mile runs and there isn't much sign of any wear and tear. It is holding up well, especially for the cost. Very happy with the purchase and if it ever does die on me, I will be purchasing another to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Graze to my underarm, it burned.
customer_reviews.text: The VUP Running Armband rotation function is ok, but the smartphone goes with your step - up and down - where I suggested it might fell off, until now everything is good. The section for the keys is a nice extra! I run approximately 5k mile daily and after my third run I thought I had a insect bite by it was a graze to my right underarm from the "Running Armband." My solution: I wear the "Running Armband" now on my left arm (after 2 runs everything ok) or just a long sleeve shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the sleeve style
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried after running with the sleeve style for so long, but I was tired of how my phone felt like it was stuck in the sleeve. I also found it hard to clean. The swivel feature of the band is not loose at all, and is not affected by the impact of running or swinging the arms. The band tightens up pretty good and has a long length of velcro to allow for different arm sizes. I use a 7+ sized phone and it fits that size as well as the smaller size my family uses. I have not used the key pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Dr3wfu55

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this armband. I wasn’t too sure if it would hold my phone securely, but so far I’ve been able to run, row, and lift weights without ever any issues. I LOVE that I can turn my phone if needed and that I don’t have a stupid plastic screen getting in the way of my touch screen and I don’t have to remove my phone case to use the armband like I’ve had to with others.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boswell

customer_reviews.title: All the little things it has are a bonus.
customer_reviews.text: What’s great about this design are the little things. The fact it has a Velcro spot for headphones. There’s a little hidden spot for a house/locker key. The best thing is the rubber parts that go over the ends of your phone, makes for easier use of the touchscreen. I dislike that if you want to wear it on the underside of your forearm so you don’t have to hold it to use rather than a workout activity it’s strap has to be folded to fit.
customer_reviews.author: IRISHCASEY79

customer_reviews.title: Nearly a year later, still feels brand new
customer_reviews.text: My Note9 with a case is tightly secured like rubber bands on the corners, so no more sleeve and loss of sensitivity, and those who love their mirror selfies can do so with ease. OK great, but how long will it last? I workout several times a week and have never gone more than a few months without seeing a loss in quality with the velcro or elasticity. Well, I bought this armband close to a year ago, and it's just as good as the day I bought it. I work out several times a week and have gone through many an armband in my time. Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Stead

customer_reviews.title: This product works great
customer_reviews.text: This product works great and it's really convenient to use while jogging. I have two phones, one is 5inches and the other is about 6inches. They both fit firmly on the armband and didn't even slip one bit when I tested it by shaking it around. The velcro is surprisingly really good material and stays on. I've sweated so much on it and it still works like the first day I got it. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sou

customer_reviews.title: Love the design
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this and think it would work well for anyone that prefers to work out with their phone on an arm band. One thing that’s great about it is that you can have easy access to the phone screen without having to worry about having the typical plastic screen barrier in the way. Holds my phone securely. I ended up preferring the wrist strap version of this product over the arm strap one though. Just my personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Sliderguy

customer_reviews.title: broken strap; ignored by customer service
customer_reviews.text: My arm band worked great until it didn't. One of the bottom straps that holds the phone in place broke and so the phone can no longer stay secured in place. I now have to buy a replacement. I purchased the arm band based on the great reviews and understand when there is an issue every so often w/ quality. What I dont understand is the company's inability or refusal to assist customers who have faulty products. Very disappointed in the company.
customer_reviews.author: jean brown

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This arm band is really good. I've had no issues with it. My main complaint would really be that it doesn't work well with how big phones have gotten over the recent years which kinda makes it a pain at times, but really only so much you or this product can do it about it. Overall this is a really good arm band I can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great for running and walking!
customer_reviews.text: I love this armband! My phone fits perfectly and easily into the band's. I'm able to access my phone easily when I work out or am going for hikes/long jogs. Band is decently comfortable as well and I quickly got used to it and had zero issues while jogging. I would definitely recommend this item to anyone! The first armband I bought was the kind that has a sleeve holder and plastic face for you phone...well...it broke after the first day of use. I was pretty bummed and scoured through a lot of Amazon armbands while carefully reading reviews. This one has a lot of positives so I took a chance and am VERY happy that I did!
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Gal

customer_reviews.title: ... the first arm band I have owned but I like this one the most
customer_reviews.text: Not the first arm band I have owned but I like this one the most. I use it with my iPhone X with a fairly bulky case and it fits great. The size around my arm is perfect too, my old one had a lot of extra slack which flopped around. Nice job!
customer_reviews.author: ERIC W

customer_reviews.title: Good armband just not for me
customer_reviews.text: This a nice way to be able to control my phone when running; however, I realized that I don't like the arm band feature. The velcro is a tiny piece of the band so unless you have the right size arm, it won't stay on. Can't use the shorter loop b/c it's too tight, and the other loop makes it too big. Shame b/c it holds the phone PERFECTLY
customer_reviews.author: Quez

customer_reviews.title: REVISED REVIEW - VUP Armband for iPhone 8+, it's the best option out there for iPhone 8 Plus
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave this two stars only because it seems they made an effort to use quality materials and decent construction. In use it is not comfortable, it feels itchy on the arm and if you have any significant muscle tone it's a difficult fit. The elastic used is not very flexible and does not stretch easily. The size for an iPhone 8+ stretches the bands to their limit. All that aside, I have become accustomed to it, it works great and having seen other options I WOULD RECOMMEND this product.
customer_reviews.author: fIA

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for iPhone 8+ With pop socket
customer_reviews.text: Not very easy to use with iPhone 8+ & popsocket. I’m a female with smaller biceps. The band Kept sliding down arm because phone was to heavy. Couldn’t realy rotate & see screen while phone was positioned on bicep b
customer_reviews.author: janene

customer_reviews.title: Awkward
customer_reviews.text: So, it works. it does what it says it does, but it's awkward. Putting that up on your arm looked great in the photo, but it's not easy to put it on and get the screen facing at a good angle and it's hard to see and use when it's strapped in. But, better than putting your phone in your pocket I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Westcott

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to really like this arm band, but no matter how I have it on my arm, it always rubs and pinches and leaves a mark. I like that my phone can swivel and it’s not behind plastic, however I don’t think I can use it anymore because of the marks it leaves from the material, and shape of it, rubbing on my arm.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Mulberry

customer_reviews.title: No other arm band worked until I bought this one
customer_reviews.text: I have a large Samsung phone and like to listen to Slacker when working out. I bought some other arm bands that said they would hold my phone. They were either too small even with the case off or they were not sturdy enough to hold the wight of my phone. So they were all a waste of money. When I got this arm band I was so happy that not only does it hold my phone (even in the Otter Box), it can hold the weight and doesn't slide down my arm. I would highly recommend this arm band to anyone looking for a good quality arm band that will fit any phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Marflak

customer_reviews.title: Needs better material for band.
customer_reviews.text: The black elastic around arm overstretches, therefore it doesn't keep it on unless it's pretty tight. I use to use one with a different material that worked better but it didn't have the rotation ability. The rubber holder holds the phone pretty tight, so that's good. It looks good just might have to wear tighter than normal so it doesn't slide off your arm.
customer_reviews.author: Naty C

customer_reviews.title: Very secure, just a little bulky for me but worth it because the phone is not coming undone!
customer_reviews.text: Velcro is very study so your phone is secure and so are the bands that secure your phone, which I was originally worried about when purchasing. It’s a little bit bulky, and I wish it would tighten tighter so I could wear it in my forearm. It definitely is secure and I’m still trying to get use to it, but your phone Is definitely not slipping out, ever.
customer_reviews.author: MSDLNH

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I was using a cheaper holder for a previous phone that didn't fit my new Pixel 2XL. The other one had a plastic sleeve with a clear plastic cover. It was a pain. This armband holds my phone completely securely, I have no worries about it sliding out. The ability to still use the screen instead of trying to get fingerprints to register through a clear plastic, plus the 180 swivel makes it perfect. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Twolabs

customer_reviews.title: Great for changing phone settings etc while working out.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs; I use this while working out and frequently need to adjust my phone screen (change apps etc.). The ability to twist the phone while it remains firmly held in the armband is essential. It holds my iPhone 6S (in its case!) securely throughput my entire workout. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: patricianyc

customer_reviews.title: Great running arm mount!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not paying attention to it is not recommended for the s8 Plus size phone but it still works great with my s8 plus. Now, I do have to take my phone out of it's slim case but the rubber bands on the arm mount holds it in place perfectly. The rotating feature works great to see my screen better to change music or cycle through information on my running app while i'm running. Each click of the rotation feature feels very solid and where ever you rotate the phone too, it will stay there. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: One complaint is that it pinches my arm badly, so I wear it near the wrist now. I have normal to small arms for a man, so think it might be worse for larger guys. That said, it is really easy to get the phone in and out. It holds the phone secure and with it on the wrist and with the swivel action, the phone is easy to work with. Not being able to wear it on my upper arm worked out better in the end for me.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper7112177

customer_reviews.title: Easy-access armband
customer_reviews.text: This armband is perfect for larger-sized phones (I have a Moto Z Force), and the strap is pretty generously sized. Easy to use on your forearm or bicep - Will come back to update after I've used it more.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne423

customer_reviews.title: Overall fail
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could return it. The turning quality was no good. I couldn’t access changing music options without a major pain. Forget face recognition! Also, the Velcro rubbed me raw on my arm.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband - and he's really happy with it. He's used it with both an LG G7 and LG V40. The holder is very strong - and keeps the phone secure. The "bands" of the holder don't hit any buttons. Really happy that he can take photos without having to remove the phone from the case. (You may have to spin your phone). Key holder is great (he carries only 1 key when running). Only issue is how to wash it - as sweat stains are starting to show.
customer_reviews.author: Kazzer

customer_reviews.title: Okay phone armband
customer_reviews.text: I use this armband for the scanners at my job. For the most part it's a lot better than the work isssued one. I got a rash from the work one which is made out of neoprene and traps in your sweat, not to mention you have to deal with the plastic top. This one is made out of fabric and elastic and it's easy to move the phone around on your arm to look at the screen. The only problem with this armband is after awhile of movement (maybe an hour or 2) the phone gets semi loose in the straps and it will fall right out.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Probably meant for smaller phones, not Galaxy S9
customer_reviews.text: The armband works okay. The band was a little small for my Galaxy S9, but I was able to get it to work with a little stretching. Overall the band is a little bulky and becomes kind of uncomfortable after about 20 minutes running. It gets the job done but would probably be more comfortable with a smaller phone.
customer_reviews.author: gratehouser

customer_reviews.title: Great product - but doesn't actually fit larger phones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design & quality materials. It's durable but doesn't feel bad against your skin. The rotation is easy but also feels really secure in whichever position you choose. I bought it for my HTC One, which is on the larger size of phones and it just barely fit. Unfortunately, my new Google Pixel 3a XL (6.3 inches) doesn't fit at all. So I'll have to find a new one instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E. Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal
customer_reviews.text: In terms of quality, it is fine. But put it on and try to tighten it, and your arm gets pinched. Every. Time. (If you’re wearing a tank top.) I have thin arms and need it tight. The way the phone is attached to the strap makes it wobble/wiggle with your arm movement when you’re running, which is very bothersome to me. It would probably work well for someone who is walking. Im an avid runner and I have gone through plenty of armbands. This one, I don’t like it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Austin

customer_reviews.title: Used and abused, it works
customer_reviews.text: I use it to hold a warehouse management device (a kind of thick phone, basically), and while I don't use it on the upper arm, but on the forearm, it's served me well. I'm surprised! The swivel joint is solid, the rubber (or whatever) clasps for holding the device are solid. Only used it for about a few months five days a week, but this is good gear. It was a good investment for me to upgrade from the cr** they give us on the job.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Best armband I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I'm going on about 5 months of owning this and I have to say that this is probably one of the best designed arm bands for working out. I've used it about 4 or 5 times a week since buying and it's pretty darn durable. It's great for running and using in the gym as well. I have an iPhone 7s Plus and it stays in place no problem. I'm able to keep it in the case as well. I'll probably end up reordering this same one if anything were to happen to the one I have.
customer_reviews.author: Beni

customer_reviews.title: Fits my phone without a case.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give the product five stars because it definitely exceeds expectations as far as what I purchased it for! That said, a question/answer implies that it can fit a Samsung Note 8 - and, it does. That's great! Unfortunately, you have to take your phone out of the case for it to fit. This is less than ideal. But, so far, the arm band holds well and I don't feel like my phone is in any immediate danger.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela Wolverton

customer_reviews.title: I like that it's easy to control my phone while running
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's easy to control my phone while running. The two different sizes on the band are in between my arm size. The tighter one pinches under my arm and the looser one doesn't pull tight enough to stay up on my arm. That's my only complaint. Otherwise it works fine. I have an iPhone 8 and it holds it very securely, I don't have any concern of it falling or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Knopp

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Gotta say, I'm very happy with this for my iphone 8. Works great for running and light sprinting. If you want to do exercises where you are jerking it around a lot, I'd get something else, as this would bother you. It just jostles around a big when running, doesn't bother me at all and my phone fits great.
customer_reviews.author: mase9921

customer_reviews.title: Training for the NYC Marathon
customer_reviews.text: I put this armband to a test as I ran on a humid day in NYC, ran about 10 miles. Unfortunately, during the run, the armband was too tough on my arm, it was rough and scratchy plus it began slipping. The only GREAT part about it was how easy I was able to rotate my phone in order to change some settings as I ran. Overall, I will be returning this as it did not make me comfortable in any way. Still on the lookout for a diffrent armband.
customer_reviews.author: montanoNY

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE & CONVENIENT!!
customer_reviews.text: I Love the VUP Armband for my IPhone 7 Plus phone, it is so comfortable on my arm I no longer have to do my walks holding my big phone in my hand. I really like that I can turn my phone to 180 degrees to view things on my screen and the convenient compartments of holding a cord and my house key. I would highly recommend the VUP Armband to anyone who enjoys, walking, running, gardening, biking or whatever activity inspires you enjoy doing and need to have your hands free. Great Price Too!
customer_reviews.author: Latina 66

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this armband for my iPhone XS for the gym. This band is light weight and easy to use. It is much easier than the older armbands where you pit the phone into a sleeve. This band has secure wrap around holders that make attaching the phone less of a workout. Also the set up makes it easier to change playlists.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: A Chef's God Send
customer_reviews.text: I am a chef at a residential mansion. I have to track the timing on as many as 12 dishes at one time. An app makes this pretty easy. I use the workout armband on my left arm at an angle so I can read it and manipulate it with my right fingers. My pocket was difficult to reach into, especially when my hands were wet or had a bit of food on them. And hanging the phone on a holder was difficult since I would sometimes be in a different part of the kitchen or in the dining room. Great product with the best solution I have found so far.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S.

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Got for new phone. The old arm band was a plastic sleev and only worked for an old iphone 3. This can fit different phones. I like that you can spin ithw phone around to see the screen better when it's on. I've had it for a couple years now and it has held up no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Works great with iPhones with home button.
customer_reviews.text: The product is great for iPhone 8 but not so much for iPhone X. It holds the iPhone 8 very securely and you are able to adjust the phone orientation into your line of sight easily. The problem to be aware of is that you need fairly large arm diameter or the band will be too big and now with the iPhone X not having a home button the straps that hold the phone in place will press up against the phone screen like you are touching it and the phone will not let you swipe to unlock. Great product for large armed and iPhones with a home button.
customer_reviews.author: Mystic River

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 Year 7 Months
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, it lasted a decent amount of time for a piece of rubber and how often I would use the strap. I used this 3 times a week or more for 19 months before the main corner that I put my phone in snapped. I will order another one since these last way longer than the plastic sleeve ones. This time around I am going to switch up the corner I put my phone into first. Another thing that lasted the entire time was the arm strap and velcro. Both sides of the velcro didn't wear out which was surprising for the amount of sticking and unsticking it went through.
customer_reviews.author: A.R. Netto

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this, but....
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these one for me and my husband. I really want to love it but I find it pinches my arm and is stiff to turn the phone when I need it. I still use it but have to adjust it often. I guess the phone not easily moving is a plus but I struggle with it. My husband seems to love his.
customer_reviews.author: EFaasse

customer_reviews.title: This armband is my new favorite workout band
customer_reviews.text: This armband is my new favorite workout band. It holds the phone super securely and the rotating face is fantastic. I have to adjust the upper strap so it doesn't hit the power button but it is not problematic at all. It doesn't irritate my arm and, as a thinner female, I'm thrilled that it's not so big that the strap won't fit.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, durable and the idea of rubber bands is great
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I would make it easier to strap it on your person but it works fine. I love that the rubber bands hold the phone very snugly and it has never once fallen out. I use it for running and the best part is that my bluetooth connection remains solid.
customer_reviews.author: freedom1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Functionality
customer_reviews.text: I love the swivel on this arm band. The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is I can't cinch it quite tight enough around my arm. Sometimes, when I'm running and get pretty sweaty, it tends to slide down due to this. I'm a female in decent shape with toned arms.
customer_reviews.author: TrustnChrist

product_meta.title: VUP Running Armband for iPhone 11 Pro Max X XR XS 8 7 6 6s Plus,Galaxy S10 S9 S8 Plus, Note 9/8/5/4,Google Pixel 3/2 XL,360°Rotatable with Key Holder Phone Armband for Hiking Biking Walking（Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackProduct Features:

●Fits most 4 to 5.5 inch smartphones, including iPhone X, iPhone 8, 8 Plus, iPhone 7, 7 Plus, iPhone 6 / 6s, 6 Plus / 6s Plus, iPhone 5 / 5s / 5c / SE, Samsung Galaxy S8, S8 plus, S7, S7 edge, and more
●180° rotation makes it easy to take pictures, check messages, and answer calls
●Full access to touch screen controls and all buttons
●Highly breathable, lightweight and comfortable to wear
●Headphone and charger cutouts allow direct access to phone accessories
●Lightweight and stretchable Lycra allows for comfortable movement
●Perfect for Running, Hiking, Yard work, Playing guitar, etc

Dimensions:
Size (L*H*W): 10.3 * 0.5 * 5.1 inches
Weight: 1.96 ounces Material: PC, Silicone, PU

You can use the wristband for: 

● Gym workouts
● Walking 
● Jogging 
● Running 
● Hiking 
● Climbing
● Biking 
● Gardening 
● Cleaning house

Provides instant, easy access to phone calls, music, apps, messages, and notifications! 

Don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions about this product:) 

Package Contain:
VUP Rotatable Sport Armband x1

PS: Warning: Please do not shake the armband vigorously as that may risk breaking the straps and causing the phone to fly off
feature_bullets: COMPATIBILITY - Uses with 4 to 6.5 inch smartphones, including Android, iPhone 5 to iPhone11 Pro Max. Common case,brands could be compatible with many case. Please read the description to see complete compatibility phone models

SKIN-FRIENDLY - Breathable Lycra and Neoprene provide soft, odor-free and lightweight wearing experience. Stretchable and washable with clean water. Extra fabric layer makes the armband sweat resistance when doing workout activity

Ater-sell & 24 hours online help- The VUP armbands are made of high quality materials, 360 degrees to adjust the viewing angle, never take your phone down; it makes it possible to play game, watch videos and read eBooks completely hands free!
FIT FOR MOST ARMS & 24-hour online service - Adjustable band and Highly elastic velcro to enjoy a comfortable fit, get peace of mind with a 30 days satisfied or a fully-backed within 1-year
FULL ACCESS & PERFECT FOR ALL ACTIVITIES - Completely access to all buttons and controls of the smartphone, look cool & Great for running, cycling, walking, hiking, and other high intensity workouts.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,505 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
